JobFullDesc: Senior Consultant, Technical Program Management Join us as a Program Manager on our Technical Program Management team in Austin, Texas to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact.What you’ll achieveAs a Program Manager, you are the Core Team leader, focal point presenting recommendations and status to our Business Executives. You will be responsible to lead and drive a diverse team of cross-functional experiences to deliver a portfolio of products and solutions that meet or exceed program and business objectives, in order to delight our customers and enable our business to grow and win. You will govern cross-functional team members to deliver to their commitment in accordance to our product lifecycle development process to maintain ISO compliance.You will:Lead a portfolio of programs; with a high degree of complexity and/or business impact.Manage risks, identify, and implement effective contingency plans.Analyze data, facts, recommends and influences business Executives.Identify strategic opportunities, lead and develop complex initiatives.Help coach and develop diverse pool of talents and cross-functional team members.Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role:Essential Requirements At least 12 years of Program Management experience in Notebook, Mobile, or related IT productsFluent English.Desirable Requirements Bachelor’s Degree or Master’s in Computer Science, Engineering or Business ManagementStrategic or Portfolio program management experiences in leading multiple and complex programsHere’s our story; now tell us yoursDell Technologies helps organizations and individuals build a brighter digital tomorrow. Our company is made up of more than 150,000 people, located in over 180 locations around the world. We’re proud to be a diverse and inclusive team and have an endless passion for our mission to drive human progress. What’s most important to us is that you are respected, feel like you can be yourself and have the opportunity to do the best work of your life -- while still having a life. We offer excellent benefits, bonus programs, flexible work arrangements, a variety of career development opportunities, employee resource groups, and much more. We started with computers, but we didn’t stop there. We are helping customers move into the future with multi-cloud, AI and machine learning through the most innovative technology and services portfolio for the data era. Join us and become a part of what’s next in technology, starting today. You can also learn more about us by reading our latest Diversity and Inclusion Report and our plan to make the world a better place by 2030 here.Application closing date: 31 August 2021Dell is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Dell are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Dell will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Dell encourages applicants of all ages. Read the full Employment Opportunity Policy here.
